#Text=Adéla Pollertová
#Text=Adéla Pollertová
#Text=( born in Prague , Czech Republic ) is a Czech ballet dancer and soloist of the National Theatre Ballet .
#Text=Education and career
#Text=Adéla Pollertová was born in Prague , Czech Republic in a sports family .
#Text=From the early age , she practiced gymnastics but when she turned 15 she decided to attend the Prague Dance Conservatory , [ 1 ] and graduated from it within less than five years .
#Text=After graduating , she went to Hamburg where at the age of 19 she joined Hamburg Ballet of John Neumeier and became its soloist with whom she worked from 1995 to 2004 . [ 2 ] [ 3 ]
#Text=Career
#Text=Early career
#Text=Before joining Hamburg Ballet , Pollertová performed lead roles such as Clara in The Nutcracker , Lisa in Wary In Vain and the solo in Balanchine ' s Serenade . [ 2 ] [ 3 ]
#Text=Hamburg Ballet

#Text=During her service at the Hamburg Ballet , she performed such roles as the Alien Princess in A Cinderella Story , Princess Florina in The Sleeping Beauty , Maria in The Nutcracker , Helen in A Midsummer Night 's Dream , Tamara Karsavina and Matilda Ksheshinska in Nijinsky ( which she also co-choreographed ) , Olympia in La Dame aux Camélias , Phoebe in As You Like It , the Wedding Couple and Zulma in Giselle , Princess Claire in Illusion – Like Swan Lake , and Juliet from the troupe in Romeo and Juliet . [ 3 ] [ 2 ]

#Text=Adéla Pollertová is also known for hear appearances in Mats Ek ' s versions of She Was Black and The Sleeping Beauty as well as Natalia Makarova ' s La Bayadère where she danced as one of the solo shadows .
#Text=She also performed a solo in Christopher Wheeldon ' s VIII and danced in Bach Suite 2 and Gustav Mahler ' s Symphony No. 3 and Symphony No. 5 .
#Text=She also had minor appearances in Bartók Bilder , Getting Closer , Messiah , and Vaslaw before joining National Theatre Ballet for the 2004/2005 season . [ 3 ] [ 2 ]
#Text=National Theatre Ballet
#Text=Adéla Pollertová joined the National Theatre Ballet after becoming friends with Petr Zuska , who was the theatre director at the time . [ 4 ]
#Text=For him , she performed as the Wedding Couple and Giselle in Giselle and Tarantella and Spanish dancer in Swan Lake .

#Text=She also did lead roles such as Clara in Youri Vámos ' s The Nutcracker - A Christmas Carol , a Queen in The Sleeping Beauty , Juliet in Romeo and Juliet , Olga in John Cranko ' s ballet Onegin , Sylph in August Bournonville ' s La Sylphide , and as Goldilocks in Jan Kodet ' s children 's ballet of the same name . [ 3 ] [ 2 ]
#Text=She also was a winner for Czech Republic in the Olympic Games and worked as an opera singer prior to her retirement in 2018 . [ 5 ]
#Text=Awards

#Text=In 1994 Pollertová was a recipient of the bronze medal for the best choreographic work of I Feel Good in Jackson , Mississippi and the same year became a winner of the National Ballet Competition in Brno .
#Text=In 1999 she was awarded Wilhelm Oberdörffer Prize and in 2006 became a recipient of the Thalia Award " for her brilliant rendition of Juliet in the ballet Romeo and Juliet " . [ 3 ] [ 2 ]
